subsc: Sub-national government administration,Health,Other social services,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
This project supports the goal of the
            national HIV/AIDS strategy of the government of Cape Verde,
            which is to reduce the spread of HIV infection in the
            country. To achieve this goal, the project will also support
            the following objectives: 1) mitigation of the health and
            socio-economic impact of HIV/AIDS at individual, household,
            and community levels, thus sustaining an economically
            productive population; and 2) establishment of a strong and
            sustainable national capacity to respond to the epidemic.
            Under the regional MAP II (report no. 20727), this project
            finances HIV/AIDS activities for the period 2002-2006. It
            has four components that reflect the two-tiered
            decentralized administrative sstructure in Cape Verde at
            national and municipal levels. Apart from the component on
            project facilitation, coordination, monitoring, and
            evaluation (which will support facilitation and coordination
            of the project), each of the remaining three components
            supports the full spectrum of HIV/AIDS prevention,
            treatment, care, and support activities that are appropriate
            at the respective level. The other three project components
            are: capacity building, public sector initiatives, and civil
            society and private sector initiatives.
